data.name: Is this a rectangle?
data.description:
This is a simple excercise originating from image analysis. 

A rectangle can be specified as 5 points tracing the perimeter of a rectangle as follows:

      4 <--------------- 3                 
      |                  ^
      |                  |
      v                  |
     5, 1 -------------> 2  

For this kata it is assumed all points are on a flat plane and all numbers are real.

Write a function which tests if five points trace a valid rectangle.

The inputs of the function are:
1. The five points, p, specifying the rectangle
2. An optional acceptable tolerance parameter, t, given as a fraction of the length of the shortest side.
- This parameter has a default of 0.05 and is coerced to be in the range between 0 and 0.5. 
- If two points are within the acceptable margin of error, then these points are considered the same point.

There are some tricky cases. For example lines, angles, and bowties are not a rectangle.
